full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement
### Title: Pest Control Services North Bay

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) has released a request for Standing Offers for Pest Control Services to be provided to the Department of National Defence (DND) at Canadian Forces Base North Bay.

### Tender Details
* **Reference Number:** WS4241277305-Doc4241335895
* **Solicitation Number:** WS4241277305
* **Publication Date:** October 3, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** October 24, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT
* **Contract Start Date:** November 1, 2023
* **Contract End Date:** September 30, 2026

### Tender Status: Expired

The procurement method for this tender is competitive and open to all qualified suppliers. The standing offer will be issued to the lowest-priced bidder for each stream applicable to the requirement:

* Stream 1: Ontario Region
* Stream 2: Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business Ontario Region

The Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) applies to this tender.

### Contact Information
For any queries or concerns, please contact David Barltrop at [david.barltrop@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:david.barltrop@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca).

### Attachment and Documentation Requirements

A comprehensive proposal that includes the required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted on or before the tender closing date and time.

### Online Access
The tender notice can be accessed through the Government of Canada Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17612234?extsite=MTc2MTIyMzRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17612234?extsite=MTc2MTIyMzRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==).

Note that the original was mostly perfectly good and you didn't need to rephrase more than 1/2 of it. 

The contractor seems to have provided the service name but they accidentally gave me both the English and French language service name. In your revised version, try to be tactful and respectfully omit the service name in French for the  reader that does not read French.
